articleContent.title: Arpeggio: 13th in C# (Shape: G)
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: 13th in C# (Shape: G)

An arpeggio is a musical technique where notes in a chord are played or sung in sequence, rather than simultaneously. The 13th arpeggio in the key of C# with a G shape involves playing the notes of the 13th chord in the key of C# using the G arpeggio shape.

## Notes and Intervals:
- G# (root)
- C (major third)
- D# (perfect fifth)
- F# (dominant seventh)
- A# (major ninth)
- C# (major 13th)

## Genre and Musical Flavor:
This arpeggio, being a major 13th in the key of C#, with a G shape, has a jazzy and sophisticated feel. It is commonly used in jazz and fusion genres to add complexity and color to chord progressions. The major 13th arpeggio creates a lush and harmonically rich sound, giving a sense of sophistication and interest to the music.

## Example Songs:
1. "Donna Lee" by Charlie Parker
2. "Spain" by Chick Corea
3. "Freddie Freeloader" by Miles Davis
